channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris and Trump’s post-debate plans. And, why climate change puts chocolate at risk
item.description: Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Harris are campaigning in swing states heavily post their first presidential debate. And, why climate change could put chocolate in danger.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Harris are campaigning in swing states heavily post their first presidential debate. And, why climate change could put chocolate in danger.

(Image credit: Grant Blankenship)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Gas stoves may soon come with a tobacco-style health warning label in California
item.description: In California, gas stoves may come with a health warning label.
item.content:encoded:
In California, gas stoves may come with a health warning label.

(Image credit: Steven Senne)
item.dc:creator: Jeff Brady

item.title: From Clinton to Trump, how talk about crime has changed since a landmark bill
item.description: Crime is a perennial issue in presidential campaigns, but experts say public perceptions of safety and justice are much different today than 30 years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Crime is a perennial issue in presidential campaigns, but experts say public perceptions of safety and justice are much different today than 30 years ago.

(Image credit: Paul J. Richards)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Who won the debate?! Our quiz won't tell you that, but we do have other trivia on it
item.description: There was a debate this week! But don't worry, we have questions about other things as well. For instance, have you been following the latest penguin news?
item.content:encoded: There was a debate this week! But don't worry, we have questions about other things as well. For instance, have you been following the latest penguin news?
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Step inside this legendary shop full of handmade costumes — while you still can
item.description: For nearly half a century, Ursula Boschet has run a legendary costume shop in Los Angeles. Now, the 90-year-old is closing up — and everything is for sale.
item.content:encoded:
For nearly half a century, Ursula Boschet has run a legendary costume shop in Los Angeles. Now, the 90-year-old is closing up — and everything is for sale.

(Image credit: Maggie Shannon for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: The Grand Canyon is experiencing one of its deadliest stretches in years
item.description: At least 16 people have died at the park this year, including five fatalities in August alone. No single factor is to blame, but several deaths have followed stretches of extreme weather.
item.content:encoded:
At least 16 people have died at the park this year, including five fatalities in August alone. No single factor is to blame, but several deaths have followed stretches of extreme weather.

(Image credit: Robyn Beck)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Union autoworkers won big after striking. A year later, some face an uncertain future
item.description: Last fall's strike against Ford, GM and Stellantis yielded record contracts for autoworkers. With a slowdown in car sales, Stellantis workers now face job cuts, production slowdowns and uncertainty.
item.content:encoded:
Last fall's strike against Ford, GM and Stellantis yielded record contracts for autoworkers. With a slowdown in car sales, Stellantis workers now face job cuts, production slowdowns and uncertainty.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: A loose electrical cable is found on ship that caused Baltimore bridge collapse
item.description: Investigators found a loose cable that could have caused electrical issues on the Dali, the cargo ship that lost power and struck the Francis Scott Key Bridge, causing the span to collapse.
item.content:encoded:
Investigators found a loose cable that could have caused electrical issues on the Dali, the cargo ship that lost power and struck the Francis Scott Key Bridge, causing the span to collapse.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Boeing machinists go on strike after rejecting contract
item.description: The deal would have raised wages by 25%, lowered employees’ share of health care costs, and boosted retirement contributions by the company. But many rank and file union members were unhappy.
item.content:encoded:
The deal would have raised wages by 25%, lowered employees’ share of health care costs, and boosted retirement contributions by the company. But many rank and file union members were unhappy.

(Image credit: Stephen Brashear)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: 3 more counts are dismissed in the Trump case indictment in Georgia
item.description: A judge has dismissed three more counts in the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald Trump and his allies.
item.content:encoded:
A judge has dismissed three more counts in the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald Trump and his allies.

(Image credit: Brynn Anderson)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas
